page.title: 06An old man in Killamarsh
page.content: We visited the Old Age Pensioner in our teacher's car. He lived in a flat up some stairs. When we got there he had some visitors but they went and left us alone. We asked him if he had many visitors and he said someone is nearly always calling but that some O.A.P.'s are very lonely. He lives by himself in the flat: his wife died three years ago. He is disabled and finds it hard to get about, but the Council and neighbours help him in many ways such as getting his shopping and the Meals on Wheels Service. Many O.A.P's live in the area and he has friends he goes to the Pub with for a drink and a game of cards. He didn't retire from his last job because he was 65, but because he was made reduntant and was too old to get another job. His disablement was caused by an accident in the pit.
